entry.title: An application of stack
entry.summary:
Description

Input a string called A, characters '(', ')', '[', ']' and others may be contained.
If:
'(', '[' are at the left of ')', ']'
 '(',')','[',']' are in pairs
then we call such string valid
Now, please write a program to judge whether your inputting string is valid.

Analysis

If you are familar with stack structure, it is easy to solve this problem.
create a stack
 define double counter:m = 0, n = 0
when meeting '[' or '(', then push stack. and m++,n++
 when meeting ']' or ')', then get the top of stack, if equal '[' or '(' then pop stack, and m--, n--, else return false
* if m == 0 && n== 0 then return true

Snippet

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

#ifndef SIZE
#define SIZE 100
#endif

typedef struct stack_t {
    char ch[SIZE];
    int top;
}STACK /* optional variable list */;

void init_stack(STACK *st) {
    st->top = -1;
}

int is_stack_empty(STACK *st) {
    return (st->top == -1);
}

int is_stack_full(STACK *st) {
    return (st->top == (SIZE-1));
}

char get_stack_top(STACK *st) {
    if (is_stack_empty(st))
        return -1;
    return st->ch[st->top];
}

int push_stack(STACK *st, char ch) {
    if (is_stack_full(st))
        return -1;
    st->ch[++st->top] = ch;
    return 1;
}

int pop_stack(STACK *st) {
    if(is_stack_empty(st))
        return -1;
    return st->ch[st->top--];
}

int judge_stack(char *str) {
    char  *p  = str;
    STACK *st = (STACK *)malloc(sizeof(STACK));
    int m,n;
    m = n = 0;
    init_stack(st);
    while(*p) {
        switch (*p) {
            case '(':
                push_stack(st, *p);
                m++;
                break;
            case '[':
                push_stack(st, *p);
                n++;
                break;
            case ')':
                if (get_stack_top(st) == '(') {
                    pop_stack(st);
                    m--;
                }else{
                    return -1;
                }
                break;
            case ']':
                if (get_stack_top(st) == '[') {
                    pop_stack(st);
                    n--;
                }else{
                    return -1;
                }
                break;
            default:
                break;
        }
        p++;
    }
    if (m == 0 && n ==0)
        return 1;
    return -1;
}

int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
    char *str  = "(((-1)))";
    int status = judge_stack(str);
    printf("%d\n", status);
    return 0;
}

entry.title: Toggle Touchpad
entry.summary:
Touchpad

I do not get any reasons to explain what is Touchpad, but which do really bring so many shit, especially when you are typing...

How avoid this

Toggle
Hot-swap
Actually, I realize both double methods:
Toggle, shell script + xbindkeys (or keybord setting under your desktop environment). As for Hot-swap, write a daemon to listen the event, if using mouse -> touchpad off, else on.

Source code (Toggle only)

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
#!/bin/bash

TOUCHPAD_ACTIVE=`synclient -l | grep TouchpadOff | awk -F"=" '{print $2}'`
synclient TouchpadOff=$(synclient -l | grep -c 'TouchpadOff.*=.*0')
if [ $TOUCHPAD_ACTIVE = "1" ]; then
    notify-send "Touchpad Status" "Touchpad on" "--icon=$HOME/Pictures/icons/touchpadon.png"
else
    notify-send "Touchpad Status" "Touchpad off" "--icon=$HOME/Pictures/icons/touchpadoff.png"
fi

Then bind this script with a hotkey you like to use, such as XF86Touchpad, which represents Fn + F6, any other keys' name? just xbindkeys -k...

Screenshot

  • gmail checker

#!/usr/bin/env python
#-*- coding:utf-8 -*-

import urllib
import socket
import os
import urlparse
try:
    import simplejson as json
except:
    import json
TIMEOUT = 10

#{{{some constants
city_zip_code = '101270101'  # chengdu zip code
                             # more zip code can be found at www.weather.com.cn
ERR_IMG = 'dialog-information'
weather_base_link = 'http://www.weather.com.cn/data/cityinfo/'
img_base_link = 'http://www.weather.com.cn/m/i/weatherpic/29x20/'
img_save_dir = '~/Pictures/gif/weather'
#}}}

def _gen_link(base_link, zip_code):
    if not base_link.startswith('http://'):
        base_link = 'http://' + base_link
        link = urlparse.urljoin(base_link, zip_code + '.html')
    return link

def _get_json(link):
    if os.path.isfile(link): #get zip code from a file, just a interface
        with open(link, 'rb') as f:
        page = f.read()
        return json.read(page)

    socket.setdefaulttimeout(TIMEOUT)
    try:
        page = urllib.urlopen(link)
        return json.load(page)
    except:
        return False

def _down_load_img(base_link, save_dir, name):
    save_dir = os.path.expanduser(save_dir)
    if not os.path.exists(save_dir):
        os.makedirs(save_dir)
    url = urlparse.urljoin(base_link, name)
    name = os.path.join(save_dir, name)
    urllib.urlretrieve(url, name)

def notify(title, msg, icon=None):
    icon = os.path.expanduser(icon)
    title = title.encode('utf-8')
    msg = msg.encode('utf-8')
    os.system('notify-send "%s" "%s" "--icon=%s"' % (title, msg, icon))

Then cronjob it

0  */1  * * *  export DISPLAY=:0.0 && /home/mocker/.bin/cronjobs/weather.py

cause cronjob use different evironment with your shell, so...export DISPLAY=:0.0 required

enjoy it!!!

entry.title: Ubuntu Lamp
entry.summary:
What is LAMP

  • Linux Apache Mysql Php
  • it is a free web developing environment

How to install lamp in ubuntu

    sudo tasksel install lamp-server

Yeah, believe your eyes, it is just so easy to install lamp in ubuntu.
During the process, which will let you set the root password of mysql.

Whether your installation is successful

*Test apache open such link in your browser: 

    http://localhost

you will see:

*Test php add test.php 

    sudo echo "<?php phpinfo();?>" > /var/www/test.php

restart apache 

    sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart

open such link in your browser: 

    http://localhost/test.php

you will see:

Then, just enjoy it:)

entry.title: Send Your Note to Your Gmail
entry.summary:
why I write such vim plugin

  • ever I used a app called gnote on android,which is used for noting
  • these days I am learning something,I note in my vim
  • I wanna sync my note with some online account of myself
  • I love the products of google,that's why I choose gmail,not sth else

part of code

gnote.vim

if !has("python")
    echo "Error:no python supported!"
    finish
endif

function! Gnote()

python << EOF
import imaplib
import time
import vim
class Gmail(object):
    IMAP_SERVER= 'imap.gmail.com'
    IMAP_PORT  = 993

    def __init__(self,usr,pwd):
        self.usr = usr
        self.pwd = pwd
        self.hld = imaplib.IMAP4_SSL(self.IMAP_SERVER,self.IMAP_PORT)
        self.status = 0

    def login(self):
        rc,res = self.hld.login(self.usr,self.pwd)
        code = self.checkcode(res)
        if code == True:
            self.status = 1
        return code

    def logout(self):
        self.hld.logout()

    @staticmethod
    def checkcode(code):
        code = str(code).upper()
        if 'OK' in code:
            return True
        else:
            return False

    def __del__(self):
        if self.status == 1:
            self.hld.logout()

    def addbox(self,mailbox):
        rc,res = self.hld.create(mailbox)
        code = self.checkcode(rc)
        return code

    def delbox(self,mailbox):
        rc,res = self.hld.delete(mailbox)
        code   = self.checkcode(rc)
        return code

    def modbox(self,oldbox,newbox):
        rc,res = self.hld.rename(oldbox,newbox)
        code = self.checkcode(rc)
        return code

    def addnote(self,mailbox,content):
        t = time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
        content = "From: %s\n\ntime:%s\n\n%s"%(self.usr,t,content)
        rc,res  = self.hld.append(mailbox,None,None,content)
        code = self.checkcode(rc)
        return code

def main():
    user = vim.eval("g:gnote_gmail_username")
    pawd = vim.eval("g:gnote_gmail_password")
    mailbox = ''.join(vim.current.buffer[0])
    gmail = Gmail(user,pawd)
    gmail.login()
    try:
        gmail.addbox(mailbox)
    except:
        pass

    note = '\r\n'.join(vim.current.buffer[1:])
    code = gmail.addnote(mailbox,note)
    if code == True:
        print 'send to %s successful!'%mailbox
    else:
        print 'send failed!'

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

EOF
endfunction

config in vim

let g:gnote_gmail_username="your_gmail_username@gmail.com"
let g:gnote_gmail_password="your_gmail_password"

in the future

if you just take a look at my code of gnote.vim,you'll find I leave some
interfaces for further functions,some functions may be useful.....maybe.

usage

things look like this:
you write your notes,diary or something else in vim,
the first line is the note folder in gmail
so,you'd better write sth meaningful in the first line

then..........

just :call Gnote()
or just bind a key for that,things will look like easy - -*

what's more?
no more........

entry.title: awalys with me
whether your QQ is online
entry.summary:

  • this is for conky
  • this is for my furture gf

#!/bin/bash
#=============================================================================
#     FileName: qqonline.sh
#         Desc: judge whether the qq is online or not
#       Author: Mocker
#        Email: Zuckerwooo@gmail.com
#     HomePage: zuckonit.github.com
#      Version: 0.0.1
#   LastChange: 2012-09-25 15:14:33
#      History:
#=============================================================================

url="http://wpa.qq.com/pa?p=1:$1:1"
size=`curl -I $url | grep Content-Length | awk -F':' '{printf"%d",$2}'`

file_online=/tmp/qqonline
file_offline=/tmp/qqoffline

rm -f $file_online &>> /dev/null
touch $file_offline &>> /dev/null

if [ $size -eq 2329 ]; then
    mv $file_offline $file_online >> /dev/null
elif [ $size -eq 2262 ]; then
    mv $file_online $file_offline >> /dev/null
fi

exit 0

Why I not use python,but shell

pythoner,pythoncoky conkypythonshell shellshell.
